Text:
(Unofficially, I'm on a mission with Master Shadow,
but I'm sure we'll get to the bottom of this!)

(I cannot afford to make any mistakes in front of
Master Shadow. I must take precautions.)
Sorry to keep you waiting.
Whoa!
Suddenly, Nu hears a voice and turns around hastily.

M-Master Cid... As usual, I had no idea you were
here.
Was it that hard to notice me?

...I had no clue. It seems I have a lot more training
to do...
I see. Good luck with that.
More importantly, is it just you here, Nu?

Master Shadow glances around like he is searching
for something. Maybe for the cat.

Yes, the cat was already gone when I came to the
rooftop.
I guess it went somewhere, huh?

I couldn't see the cat around Mitsugoshi from my spot
on the rooftop. I hear that cats roam quite a large
distance, so it might be out of sight.
I see.

Let's go on patrol. Is it all right if we head
out right away?
Yeah, no problem at all.

Shielding themselves in the night's darkness, they
make a vigilant sweep of the area around Mitsugoshi.
(I've got Master Shadow all to myself...)

(This is rare since I'm not part of the Seven Shadows.
Should I start a conversation with him?)

(This is Master Shadow up close... Lady Alpha and the
others would love this chance...)
What is it?
Huh? Wh-What do you mean...?
He suddenly calls out, raising his voice a bit.

It felt like something was looking at me from behind.
Is my mind playing tricks on me?
I-I couldn't help but gaze at your back. I mean...!
M-My sincere apologies. I'm sorry for my behavior.

It's no big deal, but is there something there?
Was there a reason you were looking?
Well...

Knowing there is no need to hide anything anymore,
Nu continues to speak with resolve.

Since we have this chance, I was hoping to have a
friendly conversation with you, like everyone in the
Seven Shadows does.
Is that so?

Yes, for example, we could...talk about my time
before I joined Shadow Garden. I'd enjoy that...
Sure, I don't mind.

Thank you very much! Where did you learn sword
fighting, Master Cid? Was it at your family's house?
Huh? Yeah, sort of.

I heard that when you first met Lady Alpha, you were
already extraordinarily strong.

It seems that your sister is also powerful. Pardon my
ignorance, but is the Kagenou family full of
experienced swordsmen...?
Hmm, I'm not sure about that. What's your story, Nu?
My story?
Nu wasn't expecting that question.

Well...I'm afraid there's nothing special about me
to tell you about, Master Cid.

You're the thirteenth member, right? Gamma told me
you were new, and I was wondering why your number
was so low.

Isn't your number supposed to correlate with
the order in which you joined Mitsugoshi?
Joined...Mitsugoshi?

(R-Right. You never know if your enemies are nearby,
so instead of mentioning the name Shadow Garden, we
act as if we're Mitsugoshi employees. That's amazing!

Well, that's because...it took a while after I joined
and I wasn't given a number until I had an
audience with you, Master Cid.
What do you mean...?
It was Lambda's decision.

I was originally an aristocrat... And I was set to
join the Midgar Academy for Dark Knights.

I was learning not only aristocrat etiquette,
but also the basics of being a dark knight.
You were set to be a dark knight, huh?

Maybe Gamma saw my potential, or perhaps I had a
solid skill base, but she taught me Shadow Garden
swordsmanship in detail.
You were the apple of her eye, so to speak.
Heehee, possibly.

Lambda made the effort to train me, both physically
and mentally, and she didn't send me on a mission
right away.
Indeed.

If Lambda trained you one-on-one, you undoubtedly
are skilled.
Yes, Lambda was my teacher, after all.
That makes sense.

They continue to patrol around Mitsugoshi, sometimes
conversing, but they don't find anything.
No cats.

There also didn't seem to be anything suspicious.
What do you make of it?
Yeah, I didn't find anything either.
Darn... We don't have any clues either, huh?
What should we do? Head back to Mitsugoshi?

...Indeed. It wouldn't be worth our while to expand
the search area anyway.
Meooow.
Huh?

When they return to the rooftop of Mitsugoshi, a cute
little animal is wagging its tail, as if it were waiting for them.
Is this...the cat you were talking about?
I-It seems so. The color and size are the same...
It wasn't here earlier. I wonder where you came from.
Master Shadow lifts the cat up as he speaks to it.
Meooow.
I see.
Do you understand what it's saying?
Not the slightest.
Master Cid...

(I wondered for a moment if Master Shadow could
communicate with animals using his wisdom.)

The cat wasn't here earlier, but it is now.
What could this mean...?

Maybe while we were on patrol, someone accessed the
rooftop and brought the cat with them.

The enemy has an entry point and they can also dodge
our surveillance! This isn't good.
It's just a coincidence, right?
...No, I don't think so.
Ah! Maybe it's the enemy that is watching us...

That would be bad news. They would outwit us at each
and every turn.
You're a constant worrier, aren't you, Nu?

I understand that cats are cute, Master Cid,
but this isn't the time to play with them.
I don't feel like I'm being watched.

Huh? B-But...the fact that it's easy to infiltrate
means that there's some way to outsmart us.

If they know that much...they might even be
clued into Mitsugoshi's true identity.
I must locate their entry route immediately...
I have to take action.
What're you going to do?

Instead of needlessly expanding our search area,
I'm thinking of setting up some traps...

Traps, huh? That might be a bit dangerous.
Delta might get caught in them...

(Master Shadow's thinking of a strategy for me...!
This is such an honor.)

I mean, if we know where the cat is entering from,
that's all we need to know.
So...how about this?
(*ring*)
Is that...a bell?

A small bell chimes clearly in the darkness. Could it
be some kind of way to find the way in?
